data.text: @hannah__lillian Dysmorphias are mental diseases, not things to be applauded. They should be treated, not glorified
@PrincessaBrunna but what drove you to do that? Looking at pictures of supermodels and celebs and wondering why you couldn't look that way?
@hannah__lillian what if starving myself or binging and purging makes me happy with my body dysmorphia? Should I go ahead and do that?
@PrincessaBrunna suicide or have 1001 other body dysmorphias because they hate themselves, then go right ahead. Be HAPPY.
@PrincessaBrunna if a surgery that changes your genitals is what makes someone happier to be inside their own skin and less likely to commit
@PrincessaBrunna extent. No one is gonna be 200% happy with how they look or feel or act because we have unrealistic standards.
@PrincessaBrunna but no one is trying to change their DNA. it's a matter of what makes a person happy. Like dimorphism is in everyone to an
@hannah__lillian go ahead, be a man who likes men and cross dresses, whatever, that's cool. But you can't change your DNA. Still a man
@hannah__lillian but because it's a man who thinks he's a woman, it's applauded?
@hannah__lillian if it was a skinny girl who thinks she's actually a fat girl super dieting and working out, we'd tell NO! That's unhealthy!
@hannah__lillian I'm just shocked at how we reject all dysmorphias, and all of a sudden this one is okay?
@hannah__lillian and I don't mean to shame. I will never say anything derogatory to anyone for their choices even if I don't agree with them
@hannah__lillian having surgery doesn't change your DNA. This causes a huge problem for health car providers and people witnessing symptoms
@hannah__lillian because gender dysmorphia is just as unhealthy. Think about all the diseases that are gender specific.
@PrincessaBrunna already uncomfortable in their own skin and has finally taken the steps to feel like themselves for the first time?
@PrincessaBrunna but can't you agree that body dysmorphia is part of a societal issue with female body image? Why shame someone who is
@robbyj_321 idk, because I'm used to using last names when writing? I'm studying law and English, it's just a habit. We never use 1st names
@PrincessaBrunna but why did you use Jenner instead of calling her Caitlyn?
@PrincessaBrunna ok! Thank you for letting me know!
@robbyj_321 I also found some research that shows that transgender parents with kids usually have them call them whatever they were before
@robbyj_321 http://t.co/JHOoR1b2J4
@robbyj_321 actually, I found an article and it said that they call Jenner dad
@PrincessaBrunna They call Caitlyn mom because she is a woman and that is what you call a woman parent.
@hannah__lillian why is gender dysmorphia okay if body dysmorphia is considered unhealthy?
@PrincessaBrunna why the quotes?
